alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jasper; Jones; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 08 at 11:16PM CST until January 09 at 2:15AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Smith County in central Mississippi... Northwestern Jasper County in east central Mississippi... Northern Covington County in southeastern Mississippi... Northwestern Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 215 AM CST. * At 1116 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Collins, Bay Springs, Taylorsville, Louin, Montrose, Sylvarena, Stringer, Turnerville and Rose Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
